intro: Downingia brachyantha, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains in California. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Downingia brachyantha is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to the cool, high-altitude environment.
